catalog.title: Bacteriology
catalog.subject: Microbiology And Immunology
catalog.requisites_description: Pre-Requisite: BCH 503 or (BMS 515 and BMS 516) with B- or better..
catalog.prerequisites: BCH 503 or (BMS 515 and BMS 516) with B- or better.

notes.note: Successful completion of BCH 503 OR BMS 503 with a grade of B or better

catalog.title: Fund of Immunology
catalog.description: Introductory lecture course; covers Anatomy and function of the immune system, cell interactions, antibody structure and function, antigen-antibody reactions, cell-mediated immunity, and biological effects of immunological  reactions. Discuss immune defense and immunophathology as it relates to allergy/hypersensitivity, inflammation, innate immunity, mucosal immunity, vaccines and tumor immunity. An understanding of the principles of biochemistry, molecular and cell biology is necessary; students lacking this background may have difficulty with this course.
catalog.subject: Microbiology And Immunology
catalog.requisites_description: Pre-Requisite: Successful completion of BCH 503 Or BMS 515 AND BMS 516 with a grade of B or better.
catalog.prerequisites: Successful completion of BCH 503 Or BMS 515 AND BMS 516 with a grade of B or better

catalog.title: Viruses and Cancer
catalog.description: Viruses are now known to cause ~15-20% of all human cancers. This course will bring students to an understanding of the various viruses known to cause human cancer, and how each type of oncogenic virus generally results in human cancer. Students will also come to understand how `cancer-virus hunters¿ first identified some of these viruses.
catalog.subject: Microbiology And Immunology

catalog.title: Advanced Virology
catalog.subject: Microbiology And Immunology
catalog.requisites_description: Pre-Requisites: MIC 515 with B or better.

catalog.title: Eukaryotic RNA Biology
catalog.description: This course entails presentation and critical analysis of recent primary literature articles pertaining to eukaryotic RNA biology. We will discuss articles covering humans and mammalian, invertebrate, and fungal model systems. Articles pertaining to any aspect of RNA processing, decay, or translation or non-coding RNA function will be considered relevant. Students will rotate with regard to choosing the paper, and the student who chooses the paper for a given week will distribute the paper and prepare a short background presentation. Each student in the group will then discuss a figure from the paper, highlighting the question being asked, the method, the results, and the conclusion. Each class will conclude with a group discussion of the strengths and weaknesses of the paper.
catalog.subject: Microbiology And Immunology
catalog.requisites_description: Pre-Requisite: Successful completion of BCH 503 Or BMS 515 AND BMS 516 with a grade of B or better.
catalog.prerequisites: Successful completion of BCH 503 Or BMS 515 AND BMS 516 with a grade of B or better

catalog.title: MS Project
catalog.description: Guided project under the mentorship and supervision of a full-time faculty in Microbiology and Immunology. This course is designed as a capstone experience and expected to conclude in a written report, fulfilling formal requirements for an MS degree under the project option in Microbiology and Immunology. Topic and activities to be performed in this project are subject to agreement between student and faculty member, including (but not limited to) laboratory research, computational or other theoretical work, literature review, or other scientific research related to the fields of study in the department.
